item.title: Hurricane Beryl to Make Landfall in Texas After Ripping Through Caribbean
item.description: More than a thousand flights were canceled as the state braced for the now Category 1 storm, which caused catastrophic damage during its path across the Caribbean.

item.title: U.K. Politics Are Unlikely to Move Sterling For Now
item.description: Sterling is likely to remain little moved by U.K. politics for now as markets monitor Keir Starmer’s first week as Prime Minister after his widely-expected landslide victory in the general election on Thursday, ING said.

item.title: Oil Slips Amid Gaza Ceasefire Talks, Hurricane Beryl Threat
item.description: Oil prices edged lower as negotiations over a ceasefire and hostage deal in Gaza resumed and traders monitored the potential effect of Hurricane Beryl on U.S. production and operations.

item.title: French Stocks Recover From Initial Fall After Leftist Alliance Win
item.description: French stocks rose while government bonds fell in early trading after a party alliance led by the far-left emerged first in the country’s parliamentary elections, pushing France toward political paralysis.

item.title: Stock Futures Lower Ahead of Busy Earnings Week
item.description: Investors are awaiting results from JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup, and will also get a fresh insight on inflation with June’s consumer-price and producer-price indexes.

item.title: Stock Futures Lower Ahead of Busy Earnings Week
item.description: Investors are awaiting results from JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup, and will also get a fresh insight on inflation with June’s consumer-price and producer-price indexes.

item.title: Gold Futures Slip But Broadly Keep Gains From U.S. Data-Driven Rally
item.description: Gold was lower in early European trading but broadly held ground after it reached its highest price since early June on Friday, driven by softer-than-expected U.S. data.

item.title: Credit Investors Need Time to Assess Election Impact on Banks
item.description: In credit markets, the surprising outcome of the second round of the French election will be the main topic, with French banks being in focus, UniCredit Research said.

item.title: Centrist-Led French Government Could See French-German Bond Spreads Tighten
item.description: If a centrist/technocrat prime minister is installed in France and political uncertainty subsides, the 10-year French OAT-German Bund yield spread is likely to tighten, Nomura said.

item.title: Carlsberg to Buy Britvic for $4.2 Billion
item.description: The Danish brewer agreed to buy London-listed soft drinks maker Britvic as part of a plan to expand in the non-alcoholic beverage market and reduce reliance on beer sales.

item.title: Thousands of Samsung Workers Walk out for Three-Day Strike
item.description: Samsung said there were no immediate disruptions to production.

item.title: Australian Businesses Dipping Into Savings, but Arrears Still Low
item.description: Australian businesses are dipping into savings to cover running costs and repay debts amid higher-for-longer rates, but arrears remain low for now, the head of business banking at the country’s largest lender said.

item.title: KKR Considers Reviving Multibillion-Dollar Sale of Goodpack
item.description: KKR & Co. is looking to revive the process to sell Goodpack, a Singapore-based global supply chain and logistics company, in a potentially multibillion-dollar deal.

item.title: Boeing Agrees to Plead Guilty in 737 MAX Criminal Case
item.description: The plane maker faces conviction and a $244 million fine for misleading air-safety regulators before two fatal crashes that killed 346 people.

item.title: Paramount Global, Skydance Agree to Merger
item.description: David Ellison’s production company would buy Shari Redstone’s National Amusements, Paramount’s controlling shareholder, as part of the deal.

item.title: Chinese Shipping Shares Drop on Reports of Gaza Cease-Fire Progress
item.description: Shares of Chinese shipping companies fell sharply on expectations of falling freight rates after Hamas reportedly signaled approval for a cease-fire in Gaza.

item.title: China Outspends the U.S. on Fusion in the Race for Energy's Holy Grail
item.description: China wants to dominate commercial fusion, a long-dreamed-of clean energy source that is attracting new investment.

item.title: European Rocket Launch Takes Aim at SpaceX
item.description: After years of delays, Europe will test launch Tuesday a new rocket that officials hope will help diminish the U.S. company’s dominance.

item.title: World Leaders Brace for Trump
item.description: International politicians are descending on Washington for the NATO summit, but their focus is on the Republican presidential contender.

item.title: Insurers Pocketed $50 Billion From Medicare for Diseases No Doctor Treated
item.description: Questionable diagnoses of HIV and other maladies triggered extra Medicare Advantage payments. “It’s anatomically impossible,” said one doctor about some cataract diagnoses.
